title: What should I do if my iPhone is disabled? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you have forgotten your passcode and if you keep entering the wrong passcode on your iPhone to unlock it you will get a iPhone is disabled connect to iTunes message. You no longer can try any probable passcodes to unlock your device. This problem is not terminal and can be easily fixed by the following methods: 1.Fix iPhone is diabled with iTunes This way of unlocking a disabled iPhone will mean that you will have to erase all the data on the phone. If you have created a backup before getting locked out of the device, this wouldn't be much of an issue as after resetting the device you can restore your phone with the backed up data. If your iPhone is disabled, you can connect to iTunes, then follow the instructions. 2.Fix iPhone is disabled with iCloud To use this option to unlock your iPhone you should have enabled "Find My iPhone" on iCloud. If you want to fix 'iPhone is disabled' error and erase your passcode with the help of iCloud note the following steps: Step 1: From another device or a laptop go to iCloud. Step 2: Sign in using iCloud Apple ID. Step 3: At the top, click on "All Devices". Step 4: Select the device which has to be unlocked. Step 5: Click on "Erase iPhone". You can now reset your passcode and by choosing a recent backup of your device you can restore all the data. 3.Unlock disabled iPhone without iTunes Tensorshare's 4uKey is a tool which has been developed to fix a disabled iPhone without the need to restore your iPhone with iTunes. It offers a simple solution to unlock your phone in case you have forgotten your passcode or you have been locked out of your device due to any other reason. To know how to unlock a disabled iPhone without iTunes and passcode follow the steps below. ·Download and install 4uKey on your PC/Mac ·open the program ·With the help of a USB cable connect your iPhone to Mac or laptop and click on "Start" ·Choose the path where you want to download Firmware package and click on "Download" ·Click on "Unlock Now" to remove your iPhone's passcode

If you remember your passcode: Start your computer; you must have on it the latest version of iTunes and must be connected to the internet.Turn off the iPhone;While off, press and hold the home button (volume down button for iPhone 7 and newer);While holding that button, connect to your computer using a lightning to USB cable. The iPhone should start, show the Apple, then a USB cable on the screen which means “connect to iTunes;”Release the button. On iTunes, you should see “iPhone detected in recovery mode - Restore or Update.” Click on Update.iTunes will now download the latest iOS version for your iPhone and install it on your iPhone. Depending on the speed of your internet connection, this may take anything from 10 minutes to a few hours.Once updated, the iPhone MAY give you the option to enter your passcode one time. Possibly after a 60 minutes countdown. If not, and it is still disabled, repeat from the beginning; except at step 5, choose “Restore.” And now the iOS firmware is already available on your computer so it will not be downloaded again. The device this time will restart without requesting the passcode but will be completely wiped clean of all data.If you have a previous iCloud or iTunes back-up of your device, you can now restore it to the device after step 7.If you don’t remember your passcode, simply follow the same steps and choose “Restore” in step 5.
